page.title: 05 Churches
page.content: Whitstable as a district is made of four parts.Whitstable itself, Tankerton, Seasalter, and Swalecliffe. This means that there are a lot of churches.There are 6 Church of England churches;St Peters, St Andrews, All Saints, St Alphege (Whitstable) St Alphege (Seasalter) St Johns (Swalecliffe).The district posesses 1 Roman Catholic church; St Marys. There are 3 F.I.E.C. churches. (Fellowship of Independant Evangelical Churches) They are at Tankerton, Seasalter, and Hamilton Road in Whitstable.There are 2 baptist churches, one at Whitstable, and one at Swalecliffe. Whitstable also has a Methodist, a Salvation Army, a United Reformed church, and Harbour Street Christian Fellowship. There is also a Jehovah's Witness' hall in Whitstable.
